intro: Gymnosiphon portoricensis, commonly known as the Puerto Rican gymnosiphon, is a rare flowering plant native to the island of Puerto Rico. It belongs to the family Malvaceae and is characterized by its unique, spirally arranged leaves and showy, yellow-orange flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forest understories. Gymnosiphon portoricensis is notable for its specialized pollination mechanism, relying on specific insects for reproduction. Due to habitat loss, it is considered endangered and is the subject of conservation efforts.
